input_text:
Job Title: Preconstruction Manager

Location: Baltimore, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Title: Preconstruction Manager

Company Overview: Our company, with over 30 years of experience, is a reputable general contractor known for delivering high-quality construction projects in various sectors. We have a strong focus on healthcare and medical projects and are committed to maintaining a family-oriented culture where employees are valued and respected. With a significant project backlog and two major upcoming projects on the horizon, we are seeking a dynamic and experienced Preconstruction Manager to join our team and lead our preconstruction efforts.

Position Overview: As a Preconstruction Manager, you will play a vital role in the success of our projects by overseeing the preconstruction phase from start to finish. Your responsibilities will include sales, planning, leadership, and organization, with the long-term goal of building a dedicated preconstruction team under your guidance. The ideal candidate will have over 15 years of experience, preferably in healthcare or medical projects, and possess excellent communication and leadership skills.

Key Responsibilities

Lead the preconstruction efforts for healthcare and medical projects, ensuring that all aspects of the preconstruction phase are completed efficiently and effectively.Collaborate with the sales team to identify and pursue new business opportunities in the healthcare sector.Develop and maintain relationships with clients, architects, engineers, and subcontractors.Prepare accurate and detailed cost estimates, budgets, and proposals for prospective projects.Utilize software such as Prolog, Onscreen Takeoff, and BlueBeam to streamline preconstruction processes and enhance project efficiency.Lead preconstruction meetings with internal teams and external stakeholders to ensure alignment and clarity on project objectives and requirements.Provide technical expertise and guidance to project teams during the preconstruction phase.Monitor industry trends and best practices in preconstruction management and implement strategies to stay ahead of the curve.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in construction management, engineering, or related field.Over 15 years of experience in preconstruction management, with a focus on healthcare or medical projects.Strong understanding of construction processes, cost estimating, and value engineering.Proficiency in construction management software, including Prolog, Onscreen Takeoff, and BlueBeam.Excellent communication, negotiation, and leadership skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Compensation And Benefits

Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.Comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare coverage, 401k matching up to 3%, vacation, and annual bonus based on company profitability.Opportunity for professional growth and advancement within the company.A supportive and inclusive work environment with a focus on employee development and well-being.

Note: This is a full-time position based in our office from Monday to Friday. We are committed to providing our employees with a rewarding and fulfilling career experience, and we look forward to welcoming a talented Preconstruction Manager to our team.

Contact Jalen Thompson for a confidetial converstation at (605) 705-3304.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States since 1990. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
